EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Banner Coop Elevator Association

4175 N. Banner Rd

El Reno, Oklahoma 73036



For further information contact: Gerald Kammerer, General Manager 405-354-5248



Risk Management Plan - EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



1. The Facility Policy



The owners, management, and employees of Banner Coop Elevator Association, El Reno, Oklahoma are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire company, or other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



A?A? Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application and for crop production nutrients.

A?A? The maximum quantity stored would be 78,795 pounds in our 18,000 gallon tank. Due to rounding requirements of the RMP Submit Program, the 78,795 pounds is rounded to 79,000 pounds

3. The accidental release prevention program



The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, Kk-611.1", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia".



4. The Five-year Accident History 



a. There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that:



A?A? Have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor

A?A? To our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program



The facility has:



a. A written Emergency Action Plan, in accordance with OSHA standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



b. Provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required
